vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
συντηρ-έω,
keep or preserve closely, ἑαυτὸν ἀδωροδόκητον[LXX]; σ. [τὴν γνώμην] παρ᾽ ἑαυτῇ keep it close, [NT+2nd c.BC+]
__2 preserve, maintain, of grants or privileges, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]:—passive, [Refs]; ἀμφότεροι -οῦνται (i.e. ὅ τε οἶνος καὶ οἱ ἀσκοί) [NT]
__3 observe strictly, τὸ τῆς φύσεως τέλος [Refs 4th c.BC+]; τὰ νόμιμα[LXX+3rd c.BC+]; τήν τε φιλίαν καὶ τὴν συμμαχίαν [Refs 2nd c.BC+]; σ. τὸ διάστημα keep distance, [Refs 1st c.BC+]
__4 watch one's opportunity, συντηροῦντα παίειν [Refs 1st c.AD+]
__5 watch over, protect, τοῖς φυλακίταις (i.e. συντάξαι) συντηρῆσαι τὰ.. γενήματα [Refs 1st c.BC+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to protect, defend; to treasure, preserve in memory; (passive) to be preserved
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to protect, defend; to treasure, preserve in memory; (passive) to be preserved
to keep safe and sound, Mt. 9:17; to observe strictly, or, to secure from harm, protect, Mk. 6:20; to preserve in memory, treasure, keep carefully in mind, Lk. 2:19*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: proteger, mantener a salvo ; preservar ; mantener en buenas condiciones ; recordar, guardar como un tesoro (LUC.2:19)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 保護, 捍衛
2) 珍藏 (路 2:19)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 保护, 捍卫
2) 珍藏 (路 2:19)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: để giữ; giữ gìn. σύν (G4862) + τηρέω (G5083)
